channel.title: Moparscape and Vista?
channel.description: does Moparscape work with Vista? Because i was thinking of buying my own laptop but no laptops come with Xp anymore. So does Moparscape work on Vista? please help! :D :D

item.title: Moparscape and Vista?
item.dc:creator: @Call_of_Duty Call of Duty
item.description:
@Call_of_Duty wrote:

[quote=“bobthecat, post:16, topic:199539”]well now… im NOT rich! i have basically pay for this thing by myself! so i don’t know about the dell…those usually run you what? like $600 or something? i only got like $380 and i get no allowance. And really i wont it so i can to homework around the house, be up in my room on it, use it in the car…stuff like that also use it at cottages such as Maine, New Hampshire, and the Cape. now i don’ own those but i go to other peoples sometimes and theirs all in those places[/quote]$380 will get you nowhere, wait for more money. $380 will get you a year out of a laptop, probably not even that far.

item.title: Moparscape and Vista?
item.dc:creator: @Call_of_Duty Call of Duty
item.description:
@Call_of_Duty wrote:

First of all, laptops are pure garbage unless you’re in college, I DO NOT recommend one unless you are mobile 50% in your life. I have an HP laptop, and it’s convenient seeing as I travel every weekend. Building a desktop would be a wise choice if you know what you are doing, I’m building one as my graduation present.

To the person above ^.

AMD is garbage if you want more than just a home computer. AMD is for general uses only such as internet. Although AMD has a more efficient processor, I think it was the Athlon or something like that, I recommend going Intel as they can have a faster and more reliable chipset.

Read full topic
